meanings.definition: relating to the administration of justice or the courts
meanings.sent1: The judicial system ensures fair trials for all.
meanings.sent2: The judge's role is to make judicial decisions based on the law.
meanings.sent3: I told a joke in court, but the judicial atmosphere didn't appreciate it.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes had a judicial gaze, as if weighing the truth of every word.
meanings.sent5: The judicial process can be slow, but it aims to uphold justice.

meanings.definition: having the power to make legal judgments
meanings.sent1: As a judge, she possesses judicial authority in the courtroom.
meanings.sent2: Only those with judicial authority can issue legal rulings.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to have a judicial demeanor, deciding who gets the best spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: His words carried a judicial weight, influencing the outcome of the case.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility of making judicial decisions requires careful consideration.

meanings.sent1: Her judicial tone indicated disapproval of the situation.

meanings.sent3: The dog gave me a judicial look, as if assessing my choice of treats.
meanings.sent4: His smile was almost judicial, hinting at a hidden opinion.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's feedback was clear and judicial, guiding students towards improvement.
